chapter.title: Multiple Database Connections
chapter.para: This is still being tested and debugged but to use this feature:

listitem.para: specify multiple <dbconnection> elements in the dbforms-config.xml
It is allowed to have at most 1 connection without an id within a config file. That will be the default connection.
Specify the dbConnectionName to be the id of the dbconnection you wish to use in relevant tags including: dbform, tableData, queryData, getConnection, blobContent
listitem.screen:
<db:select fieldName="tc">
<db:queryData name ="combinations" query="SELECT DISTINCT tc, tier, course FROM coursesORDER BY tc" disableCache="true" dbConnectionName="simple"/>
</db:select>
listitem.para: would be used with a connection such as the following:
listitem.screen: <dbconnection id = "simple" <<< this will be used for the connectionName (your arbitrary choice) isJndi = "false" isPow2 = "true" connectionProviderClass = "org.dbforms.conprovider.SimpleConnectionProvider" connectionPoolURL = "" conClass = "org.postgresql.Driver" name ="jdbc:postgresql://localhost/myDatabase?charSet=ISO-8859-1" username = "postgres" password = "" />
